criteria.title: Non-text Content
criteria.description: All non-text content has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose.
criteria.remediation: Add descriptive alt attribute to images. Use alt="" for decorative images.

criteria.title: Info and Relationships
criteria.description: Information, structure, and relationships can be programmatically determined.
criteria.remediation: Use semantic HTML elements. Ensure heading hierarchy is logical.

criteria.title: Meaningful Sequence
criteria.description: Content order is meaningful and preserved in code.
criteria.remediation: Ensure DOM order matches visual reading order. Avoid CSS that creates confusing reorder.
criteria.example: Place content in logical reading order in HTML source.

criteria.title: Use of Color
criteria.description: Color is not the only visual means of conveying information.
criteria.remediation: Use text, icons, or patterns in addition to color to convey information.
criteria.example: Error fields have red border AND error icon AND text description.

criteria.title: Keyboard
criteria.description: All functionality is available from a keyboard.
criteria.remediation: Ensure all interactive elements are focusable and operable via keyboard.
criteria.example: Use native button elements or add tabindex and keyboard event handlers.

criteria.title: No Keyboard Trap
criteria.description: Keyboard focus can be moved away from any component.
criteria.remediation: Ensure Tab and Shift+Tab can move focus. Allow Escape to close modals.
criteria.example: Modal dialogs should trap focus inside but allow Escape to close.

criteria.title: Bypass Blocks
criteria.description: Mechanism to bypass blocks of repeated content.
criteria.remediation: Add skip navigation link or use landmark regions.

criteria.title: Page Titled
criteria.description: Web pages have titles that describe topic or purpose.
criteria.remediation: Add descriptive title element that identifies the page content.

criteria.title: Link Purpose (In Context)
criteria.description: Link purpose can be determined from link text or context.
criteria.remediation: Use descriptive link text. Avoid generic 'click here' or 'read more'.
criteria.example: View all products instead of Click here

criteria.title: Language of Page
criteria.description: Default human language can be programmatically determined.
criteria.remediation: Add lang attribute to html element.

criteria.title: Error Identification
criteria.description: Input errors are identified and described in text.
criteria.remediation: Provide clear error messages that identify the problem.

criteria.title: Labels or Instructions
criteria.description: Labels or instructions provided for user input.
criteria.remediation: Associate labels with form fields using for/id or wrap input in label.

criteria.title: Parsing
criteria.description: No duplicate IDs, elements properly nested.
criteria.remediation: Ensure all IDs are unique. Fix HTML nesting errors.
criteria.example: Each id attribute value must be unique on the page.

criteria.title: Name, Role, Value
criteria.description: UI components have accessible name, role, and state.
criteria.remediation: Use correct ARIA roles and states. Ensure custom widgets are accessible.

criteria.title: Contrast (Minimum)
criteria.description: Text has contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 (3:1 for large text).
criteria.remediation: Increase contrast between text and background colors.

criteria.title: Resize Text
criteria.description: Text can be resized to 200% without loss of content.
criteria.remediation: Use relative units (em, rem) for font sizes. Test at 200% zoom.

criteria.title: Reflow
criteria.description: Content reflows at 320px width without horizontal scrolling.
criteria.remediation: Use responsive design. Avoid fixed widths. Test at 320px viewport.
criteria.example: Use CSS flexbox/grid and max-width instead of fixed width.

criteria.title: Non-text Contrast
criteria.description: UI components have 3:1 contrast ratio.
criteria.remediation: Ensure button borders, input borders, and focus indicators have 3:1 contrast.

criteria.title: Multiple Ways
criteria.description: Multiple ways to locate pages within a set.
criteria.remediation: Provide navigation, search, and/or sitemap.
criteria.example: Include main navigation, search function, and sitemap link.

criteria.title: Headings and Labels
criteria.description: Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
criteria.remediation: Use descriptive headings that convey content structure.

criteria.title: Focus Visible
criteria.description: Keyboard focus indicator is visible.
criteria.remediation: Ensure focused elements have visible focus indicator.

criteria.title: Consistent Navigation
criteria.description: Navigation is consistent across pages.
criteria.remediation: Keep navigation in same location and order across pages.
criteria.example: Main navigation should appear in same position on all pages.

criteria.title: Consistent Identification
criteria.description: Components with same functionality are identified consistently.
criteria.remediation: Use same labels for same functions across the site.
criteria.example: Always use 'Search' not sometimes 'Search' and sometimes 'Find'.
